toc_entry.title: The Perfect River
toc_entry.description: From giant fresh water prawns to bikini-clad coeds, from ancient Indian artifacts to swimming pigs, there’s something for everyone on the San Marcos River.

toc_entry.title: Country Boy
toc_entry.description: Texas cities are full of people who grew up in the country—and want everybody they meet to know it.

toc_entry.title: Play (It One Last Time With Feeling) Land
toc_entry.description: When San Antonio’s Playland closed last year, Texas lost its sentimental favorite among amusement parks.

toc_entry.title: Trial By Piano
toc_entry.description: Why knock yourself out for two grueling weeks at a piano competition in Fort Worth? For $12,000—and a string of concert bookings money can’t buy.

toc_entry.title: The Deal That Didn’t Work
toc_entry.description: Parceling out three new seats in Congress sounds like an easy job, but the Texas Legislature tried for two months and couldn’t do it.

toc_entry.title: 107 Angry Men
toc_entry.subtitle: Politics
toc_entry.description: Texas Fathers for Equal Rights joined divorced men from all over the country to protest family courts that have always favored mothers in child custody cases.

toc_entry.title: Unentitled
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: Artists and art organizations are getting cut off from the federal dole—and maybe that’s not such a bad thing.

toc_entry.title: She Followed Me Home, Mom, Honest
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: The dog that the family fell in love with was beautiful, well trained, and friendly. The only trouble was, she wasn’t theirs.

toc_entry.title: The Fifty Best Texas Books
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: One man’s favorite writings span a century and capture Texas in all its grimness and glory.

toc_entry.title: Hrills, Chills, Action, Adventure
toc_entry.subtitle: Film
toc_entry.description: Raiders of the Lost Ark gets an A, but it’s still a B-movie. Arthur has a dead plot but lively humor. Stripes should have been scuttled.

toc_entry.title: The Neon Lights Are Bright In Dallas
toc_entry.subtitle: Theater
toc_entry.description: Dallas productions of The Elephant Man and Children of a Lesser God proved that Broadway is getting closer to home.

toc_entry.title: Cruel And Unusual Parenthood
toc_entry.subtitle: Crime
toc_entry.description: Every year thousands of men and women in Texas assault, molest, or murder innocent victims—their own children.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Mr. Boll Weevil goes to Washington; Dallas scholars go to the Sunbelt’s defense; Houston’s public abortion clinic goes down the drain.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Bombs away on the Franklin Mountains; why pro-nukes belong in the Nutt House; the Dallas News goes public; sportfishermen change their minds about redfish.
